title: My Family and Community

vocab.definition: People who live together and care for each other
The place where you live with your neighbors
The place where you live with your family

teachingNotes: Share family photos and discuss different family structures. Create classroom community. Talk about helping family and neighbors.

sample.question: What does your family do together?
How does your family take care of you?

truefalse.question: Families can have different numbers of people.
All families look exactly the same.
Communities have many families living together.
Only big families are real families.
Families only include people who look the same.

multiplechoice.question: What is a good way to help your family?
expectedAny: putting away toys helps the family

multiplechoice.question: What makes people part of a family?

choices: people who care for each other

wordProblems.question: Maria's family has 2 parents and 3 children. How many people are in Maria's family?
In Jake's neighborhood, there are 8 houses on his street. If 3 houses have children, how many houses don't have children?
At the community picnic, there were 12 families. If 4 families left early, how many families stayed?
Emma's family invited 6 neighbors for dinner. If 2 more neighbors came later, how many neighbors came total?
There are 15 children in the community playground. If 7 children went home, how many children are still playing?
Sam's apartment building has 9 families. If his family and 2 other families have pets, how many families have pets?
The community garden has 20 plots. If 13 plots have vegetables and the rest have flowers, how many have flowers?
